ygData.messageBody:
One flaw in that. Rangers (as well as paladins) COULD wear plate. Rangers
just could not cast spells in plate mail. For all intents and purposes the
ranger was EXACTLY the same as a fighter, except a few VERY minor things.
They get 1d8 hit die instead of 1d10 like a fighter, yet they still get the
constitution bonus. They still get the strength bonus, but were limited in
weapon specialization. They got the same number of attacks per round, except
at higher levels and even then it was only a half-attack (every other
round). Look closely at any AD&D table except experience. They group
Fighters, Rangers and Paladins all into one group, subclassed the
'fighter-type'. But I am not trying to argue the fact of rangers vs.
warriors vs. paladins..... Just warriors vs. damage of other classes. maybe
just having some really sweet warrior only weapons would be better than
adding new skills? I mean a warriors strength is his weapon, and warriors
are supposed to have the greatest variety of weapons, right? Oh well, I
guess it's becoming a moot point. I am starting to get very opinionated (too
late hehe) about this subject, mainly because I like to solo sometimes and
at 10th level I really couldn't do that anymore because monsters were
hitting me for twice as much damage as I was hitting them for, and twice as
fast. Ok, I am done....sorry for the mindless banter ;-}~

Jynxx
